thread.title: TEXAS WOMEN END 7 YEARS OF LOSING TO BU
thread.title_full: TEXAS WOMEN END 7 YEARS OF LOSING TO BU

author: info@scout.com (Chip Brown)
title: TEXAS WOMEN END 7 YEARS OF LOSING TO BU
text:
TEXAS WOMEN END 7 YEARS OF LOSING TO BU Chip Brown Yesterday at 7:44 PM Seven years of futility for No. 12 Texas against No. 2 Baylor came to an end Monday night in Waco as Brooke McCarty scored 22 points and Ariel Atkins added 20 for Texas, and the Longhorns ended a 14-game losing streak against Kim Mulkey's Bears and snapped BU's streaks of 54 straight home wins and 29 straight Big 12 wins with an 85-79 victory. 
Texas, which has won 17 straight to improve to 19-4 (13-0 Big 12), also ended a 21-game winning streak by Baylor (23-2, 12-1), whose only loss came at No. 1 UConn, 72-61, back on Nov. 17. 

Texas led by as many as 16 in the game, but BU went on an 18-3 run to tie the game for the first time - 74-74 - with 2:06 left. 

The Longhorns answered by going 3-of-3 shooting and 5-of-6 from the FT line in the final 2:06 and never allowed the Bears to take the lead in the game. 
Sophomore Lashann Higgs and freshman Joyner Holmes both hit field goals and two free throws each in the final 2:06. McCarty hit one of two foul shots with 24 seconds left, putting Texas up five (81-76), and Briana Taylor rounded out the scoring with a layup with four seconds left. 
Holmes added 18 points and 10 rebounds for Texas, which won the points in the paint - 42-38 - primarily thanks to the penetration of McCarty, Atkins and Higgs (16 points). Texas was relentless in grabbing rebounds and running and scoring in transition. 
The Longhorns' outscored BU 10-0 in fast-break points and overcame 24 points from Baylor sophomore, 6-foot-7 center Kalani Brown and 19 points from Alexis Jones, the older sister of Texas freshman guard Andrew Jones. 
NEXT UP: ... Kansas (7-16, 1-11 Big 12) ... Saturday at 1:30 pm CT ... Erwin Center ... (LHN)
